review_title: Great place to start in healthcare
job_title: Mental Health Worker in Maryvale, AZ
pros: There’s amazing benefits and the culture is great
cons: I wish the pay was higher

pros: The people you work day to day with are great and will become some of your best friends. The people who interviewed me were thoughtful and I could tell they knew they’re working for a sinking ship without any help on the way.
cons: Don’t expect a phone call to schedule an interview. Check your spam mail for their impersonal, generic screening questions. They’re looking for inhuman BODIES not PEOPLE. The HR team will NOT negotiate salary. They may try to make it seem like they’ll reconsider, but it’s only for pennies they were skimping from you in the first place. Literal pennies. You can make the same wage in retail without extra deductions, the fear of being assaulted by patients, and the expectation of “going above and beyond” in a health care organization that won’t make minimal effort for you. From what I’ve heard (only stayed a few months), this place has gone downhill fast the last couple years, and the HR department is sketchy, even for HR.

pros: New hospital being built and will get out of an outdated building
cons: Pressure to perform tasks outside of scope of practice. Nurses constantly sexually harassing each other. Nurse externs do not get to do there job, they only are used as PCTs. Management are rude and don’t keep promises. There is major favoritism. Everything is one sided when it comes to complaints and they do not listen to the other persons side. They do not care if you get hurt on the floor they brush it off.

pros: Schedule and hours Inexpensive health coverage
cons: Management Preference between employees Unorganized

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Some of the colleagues are professional.
cons: Lack of education in specialty area, bullying, high nurse to patient ratio.

pros: Great benefits and an actual retirement with pension!
cons: It's far from my home, long commute but you get used to it.

pros: Good Team work Welcoming Friendly
cons: Entitled staff No punitive action for bad behavior Set schedules

review_title: Executive Leadership have too many unrealistic expectations
pros: Benefits are decent. The mission to help patients is supported by most of the staff. There are a lot of discounts to help the patients who cannot afford healthcare services. A lot of experience on multiple levels within the organization.
cons: The pay is not aligned with a market analysis within the valley. You can make more working at McDonald's. Executive leadership is allowed to treat employees disrespectfullly. HR does not deal with complaints against executive leadership. Some of the clinical staff are only there to make money and do not support the mission and treat support staff as servants. There is a late arrival policy that penalizes patients for not arriving on time but the providers can make patients wait for an hour after the start of the appointment without any concern for the patients or accountability to the provider. It takes weeks for patients to get a follow-up or a specialty appointment because several of the DMG providers are leaving.

pros: Leadership was not over saturated. You could really get to know the upper leadership.
cons: At time communication was not as good as it could have been

pros: Supportive management, challenging environment, fulfilling work, great educational opportunities, public teaching hospital, state pension offered
cons: Not many. Challenging clientele at times.

pros: Great state pension plan that’s worth getting into and staying in.
cons: The Care Management department is extremely top heavy in the mid- management level, lack motivation, have a very poor reputation outside of the company and no accountability so it won’t change.

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Phoenix, AZ

cons: Social workers are like teachers. We are over looked, we are not appreciated for our work. Seldom do we get recognized for our efforts from both client and establishment.

review_title: Great organization with a clear mission
job_title: Digital Marketing Manager in Birmingham, AL
pros:
-great community impact serving the underserved
-opportunity to interact with several community leaders (board members, donors, etc.)
-flexible hybrid work environment (work at home or in the office)
-medical and dental are both paid for
-offers bonuses to staff
-small organization that collaborates across departments with quick access to the CEO
-growing organization with new positions added each year
cons:
-salaries offered can be lower than industry average
-working through a recent rebrand, not everyone in the general public knows about our organization
-partnered with a government institution (Valleywise Health), it can be hard to move processes along quickly and there can be several hoops to jump through to get things approved

pros: The “frontline” employees that you work alongside are great people.
cons: Everything above the frontline employees. If you voice a disagreement with or anything else then you’re told that you’re replaceable. This place pays so little though that they can’t get any applicants right now in a market where you can literally get ANY job and get paid more. So who do they plan on replacing everyone with? They don’t think that far ahead. The whole organization is managed like garbage from the top down.

review_title: You’re either gonna really like it here OR hate it.  No in between!!!!!
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Fair salaries and Employees are Off all federal holidays.   There job stability because Very tough to get fired here (for  poor work performance alone ).   It’s a Low stress and Very low expectation work environment,  even for the resident physicians (they don’t have to comply with order sets or anything).  A lot of management is military and they help each other out.   The CEO is  very easy going and is watching out for  his retirement from a published base salary of 550k
cons: There is no data integrity here. The COO blames middle management for years of inherited error.   (Eg. sweet spot meetings) .  Executive Leadership is not engaged with what front line staff are working on.  They stay in the ivory tower all day and make guest appearances at trainings led by grossly overpaid unqualified leaders who’ve worked with the COO in the past.   They preach the “it’s a new sheriff in town routine” but  it’s the same ol  foolishness portrayed as TammyWynette in  high heels.

review_title: A great health system that feels like family
pros: Benefits  are good, ASRS retirement is vested after 5 years. People are GREAT!  They work here because they care about people and helping those who need it most in our community.  Everyone is treated with respect.  The teaching aspect of the hospital pervades the environment and everyone is helpful and willing to take time out to educate, train and teach.
cons: ASRS contribution is more than most 401/403k contributions. If you are counting every penny in your paycheck this can come as a big surprise.

pros: Leadership is very Supportive of Nursing
cons: Leadership can be out of touch with daily challenges

pros: Nice people to work with
cons: Bad pay for what you do

review_title: Long term employee, saw lots of issues
pros: The average employee tends to be very nice and dedicated. Mandatory contribution to ASRS. Discount on co-pays for using some MIHS facilities. Education reimbursement includes tuition and books.
cons: Top heavy in management. Management also is very against change. Rules, laws and regulations are thrown out the window for anything a manager wants or is comfortable doing. Human Resources always sides with management, no matter what occurs. Sexual harassment (including inappropriate touching) has zero consequences for the offender. The victim almost always ends up leaving. Anyone who is not a manager is expendable. High turn over from people who have integrity and cannot keep quiet when they see things that are wrong or flat out illegal. They tend to promote people who have no management experience and just make it up as they go. The behavioral values are a joke, just used as a reason to rate you poor on your annual review so you do not get a raise. Transfers are very hard as the managers all talk to each other. "I know her manager is just trying to get rid of her, I don't want that problem in our department." - actual quote from my manager when a current employee applied for an open position in our department.

pros: Working 3-12 hour days a week, My co-workers were nice and enjoyed working with them but at first it was kinda hard to fit in, pretty clicky, but I did actually LOVE MY JOB, but left because of manager. Benefits are AWESOME, Retirement and health ins, etc........
cons: Management changed I thought our 1st manager was bad well the 2nd and current one is sooo HORRIBLE SHE IS CHASING EVERYONE OFF EVEN PEOPLE THAT HAD BEEN WORKING THERE IN THE SAME DEPT FOR YEARS THEY LEFT AND SHE LOVES EVERY MINUTE OF IT, SHES MEAN, SHE LAUGHS AT YOU WHEN SHE IS MAKING YOU TEAR UP OR CRY SHE THINKS ITS FUNNY, SHE ENJOYED THE JOB TITLE SHE HAS AND THE POWER SHE HAS OVER EVERYONE,  SHE DOESN'T WANT TO TREAT PEOPLE FAIRLY OR WORK WITH HER EMPLOYEES, WORST SITUATION I HAVE EVER BEEN IN.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT in Phoenix, AZ
pros: The hospital is a great place to work and I was so happy to be employed there until my retirement.    The benefits are very good, the work conditions are very good and the never ending change in technology is superb!
cons: The only downside is maybe the area in which the hospital is located and it was not the best in advanced design and interior quality or decoration.

pros:
Benefits
PTO
Free Parking
Mostly Friendly CoWorkers
Pay is Fair
Some leaders are awesome
cons:
Really do your homework before you come here, interview your managers and make sure they are good fit for you. Ask about change control process, remote time, etc. Ask about their turnover of the team, ask to meet the team members other than the lead.
If you live out of state, ask them to fly you out for an interview. You can learn a lot about a leader by an in person interview. 

-Poor Leaders with no sign of improvement 
-Archaic Remote Policies
-Slow to move changes (not all teams)
-No Career Development (some teams)
-Disorganized
-Poor Project Planning - need to hire real PMs

job_title: Healthcare Data Analyst in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Valleywise Health is a safety net hospital so you feel like the work you’re doing is actually helping the people that need it.
cons: Really restrictive HR policies compared to my previous positions; Not much communication between teams;You aren’t provided with all of the new hire specifics prior to accepting the job which means you find out new things during your 1st week that might’ve made you reconsider taking the job. I personally had an awful supervisor and felt that senior leadership didn’t care to take the time to investigate.

review_title: Health Unit Coordinator, not computer programmer
job_title: Computer Programmer I in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Great place to start since there people are willing to help you out or teach the ropes. 

Majority of staff have good hearts and work hard to do their best.
cons:
Management and patients can be chaotic at times esp on top of the exhausting workload. 

Severely understaffed atm due to expansion and high turn over

Not a place for everyone but you can get a good pension if you stick around +10 years. 12% of your paycheck is automatically deducted to go into this retirement pension.  Think they contribute you up to 50% after 5 years and 100% after 10 years.

review_title: Very unprofessional, no sense of urgency for patients, human resource is a joke
pros: Discounted health benefits..that is pretty much it. The rest of it are ways for the hospital to earn money from employees like the cafeteria and coffee shop.
cons: There is a low morale, bullying/harassment of employees, and creating high paying jobs without job postings. Nobody wants to be accountable for anything, seen patients being ignored or made fun of. It is a very childish environment anything brought to HR is not handle so the behavior continues.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Critical service to the community and shows pride in providing professional care and serving the patients of the Hospital District within Maricopa County. Management is diligent in supporting staff and, even though money is very tight, tries to offer a quality workplace
cons: The IT organization struggles to keep up with modern advances in technology due to limited funding. The HR organization is behind the times and often loses good candidates due to their backward policies and practices

pros: Excellent Retirement and health care benefits.
cons: New employee orientation is well organized. Once you leave orientation you see the real politics, the county mentality, and good ol' boys clubs. Leadership values are not aligned with the mission and vision. It's a dictatorship. Employees are not valued.  Ethics and values are nonexistent in the leadership. Poor work life balance, don't expect to fulfill your role as a parent if  you want to work here. You will be a slave to your phone and e-mails even on your days and you will not be compensated for it in any way. Creativity is not welcomed. It's not what you objectively achieve, it's how you suck up to your leadership.

review_title: Run Far Away from the Revenue Cycle IT
pros: Money, Parking, Air to Breathe, I’m not locked to my desk but mind as well be.
cons: Absolutely worse manager you could ever imagine. They purposely hire people from out of state to lock them in one year contracts and then torture their staff. It’s where your soul will go to die.  Ask about the turn over before you join, when more people leave then stay, it’s a sign especially when they are new hires.  Also notice as a soon as a bad review goes up, a couple days later a positive and vague one goes up? I smell something fishy.

job_title: Lab Assistant Phlebotomist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Benefits are better than most, forced retirement plan (not optional), competitive pay, yearly increases. Pathology gives gift cards to every employee during Christmas.
cons: Morale is typically low in a lab where you are in close proximity to coworkers with gossip and drama that is usually ignored if supervisors are inept. High turn-over rate, and this is not due to advancement.

review_title: I’m part of a great team and feel as though the work that we do really makes a difference in the lives of our patients

pros: The population we work with is very challenging as well as rewarding. I love this job
cons: I wish there were a location closer to my home

cons: Long hours and diminishing resources are always a problem in healthcare environments. No different here.

review_title: Not a nice place to work

pros: Loved the patient population.  Fellow staff like family. Salary and benefits very fair. Lots of opportunities to be involved in community events.
